column1: Tanuku is a town in West Godavari district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. It is the mandal headquarters of Tanuku mandal in Kovvur revenue division.Tanuku is the fifth largest town in the West Godavari district after Eluru
column3: Tadepalligudem and Palakollu in terms of population.

column2: the town was known as Tarakapuri
column3: the capital of Asura King Tarakasura.

column1: Tanuku is a located at 16.75°N 81.7°E﻿ / 16.75; 81.7. It has a tropical climate and an annual rainfall of 313.4 millimetres (31.34 cm). The Gosthani River flows through the town.

column1: Tanuku Municipality was constituted in 1979 as a second grade municipality. It was upgraded to first grade in 2002 and has 34 election wards. Its jurisdiction is spread over an area of 24.56 km2 (9.48 sq mi). The present municipal chairman is not yet  elected and the municipal commissioner is M. Sambasivarao.Tanuku assembly constituency represents Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly
column2: which is one of the segment of Narasapuram Lok Sabha constituency
column3: representing the Lok Sabha in Indian general elections.

column1: Andhra Sugars Limited supplies liquid hydrogen to the ISRO
column2: for using it as a rocket propellant in satellite launch vehicles. The other byproducts are also used in liquor
column3: paper and power industries. It is also famous for its many hair processing industries located in  the Industrial estate

column1: Tanuku is the birth place of Adikavi Nannaya
column2: regarded as the first poet of Telugu language. He is credited with translation of  the Mahabharata from Sanskrit to Telugu. Javvadi Yamini Narasambika in dance
column3: AJS Ramareddy in literature and poetry and Dampuri Narayanarao in folk arts have won the Ugadi Purasakarams

column1: The town has a total road length of 148.6 km (92.3 mi). The Andhra Pradesh State Road Transport Corporation operates bus services from Tanuku bus station. Tanuku railway station is categorized as a Non-Subruban Grade-5 (NSG-5) station in the Vijayawada railway division. Rajahmundry Airport is 65 km from the town.
The primary and secondary school education is imparted by government
column3: under the School Education Department of the state. The medium of instruction followed by different schools are English
column4: Telugu. Higher education institutions include the SMVM Polytechnic College which provides technical courses. SKSD mahila Kalasala which offers under graduate and post graduate courses.

column1: Chitturi Subba Rao – Gopichand Badminton Academy is the badminton academy under the Chitturi Subba Rao Trust for training the under 13 badminton players. The academy hosted the COSCO A.P. State Open Mini Badminton Championship 2016. The Tanuku Football Club is one of the teams in the Football League of West Godavari tournament
